title: Test
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Production in million metric tons, with a total of 18 data points.
Overall Production in million metric tons has increased over the Year.

Production in million metric tons is roughly constant from 2000 to 2002, slightly increasing from 2002 to 2003, roughly constant from 2003 to 2004, slightly decreasing from 2004 to 2005, roughly constant from 2005 to 2008, gradually decreasing from 2008 to 2009, gradually increasing from 2009 to 2013, slightly decreasing from 2013 to 2015, and lastly roughly constant from 2015 to 2017.
The steepest decrease occurs in between the Year 2008 and 2009.
Max Production in million metric tons about 7.38 was recorded at Year 2003
Min Production in million metric tons about 4.62 was recorded at Year 2009
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Production in million metric tons, with a total of 18 data points. The chart has 7 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2011 to 2015.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely decreasing which exists from 2000 to 2003.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2015 to 2017.
Similarly, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2009 to 2011.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2007 to 2009.
Conversely, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2005 to 2007.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately decreasing which exists from 2003 to 2005.
